Bon jeu d'énigmes avec une histoire plutôt bien faite, des graphiques en 3D. Ce n'est pas vraiment un classique des SOC, car seules les phases de déguisement ou d'ouverture de portes sont des scènes d'objets cachés.
Les déguisements sont bien faits, c'est une bonne idée.
Par contre la version FR ne permet pas la lecture des parchemins, et donc les pierres a retrouver ne servent a rien.
Le chapitre 1 est bien fait, ensuite cela se dégrade un peu.
C'est un jeu moyen qui tend vers bien, durée de vie 4 à 5 heures avec le chapitre bonus.
Je note avec un pouce positif

review:
Refreshing Medieval Fantasy HoG after playing mostly Victorian and Modern day settings 

 You play as a Thief and the game does a good job implementing mechanics reflecting that fact and giving the player a "DnD Thief class" feel. The actual hidden object scenes make sense within the story, instead of being just the usual "click on random things".

 The presentation is quite good. CGI looked better then the previous Hog's i've played and the soundtrack, while not much varied, was good and never got tiresome to listen to ( there is a very nice pipe organ one, that sets the atmosphere perfectlyl)

 There were 2 things i didn't liked, tho:

- The bonus chapter Doesn't feel like bonus at all. Its just the ending of the main story, instead of the usual epilogue or prologue 

- Arbitrary places to click for the game to register inputs when interacting with objects. I know its kinda a HoG thing in general, but it felt a little bit too much in this one. Sometimes you know what to do and what object to use but the game demands that you click in a very specific place within a image to actually trigger the thing, what leads to some frustrating  clicking around 

 Good game overall

review:
Il règne dans ce jeu un parfum d'inachevé.
Alors que l'univers de l'histoire, les personnages et les énigmes sont intéressants, ils semblent également non terminés, juste esquissés, et ce, bien que les graphismes et la musique soient très agréables.

Notons, d'abord, qu'un nombre important de parchemins utiles à la résolution des mini-jeux sont non-transcrits : ainsi, vous voyez passer rapidement l'information, qui devrait être ensuite écrite dans votre journal, sauf qu'il n'y a qu'une page blanche qui s'affiche dans ce dernier. Difficile alors de résoudre les énigmes sans les indices nécessaires pour cela.

Remarquons également le manque de cohérence dans le cheminement de l'histoire : il suffit d'observer, pour trouver les objets à récupérer pour progresser dans l'action, mais il manque un réel récit pour en saisir la logique.

De même, on aurait aimé en savoir plus sur ces personnages, qui ont une réelle profondeur, sans que l'on ait les clefs pour y accéder. Ainsi, l'héroïne vit dans la rue avec son petit frère, mais l'on ne sait pas pourquoi.

Enfin, on attend dans ce genre de jeu des items à collecter, des récompenses à obtenir. Mais là, encore une fois, rien.

Il est certes manifeste qu'un second volume devait être créé. Cependant, pour cela, il faudrait déjà que le premier volume soit réussi.

review:
Graphic adventure game,  hidden object, pastime.

PROLOGUE

We are in the Middle Ages, an era where people are dominated by superstitions and live with fears and lack of knowledge.
While culture and science try to make their way to improve people's lives, those in power try to avoid all this because a people who live in ignorance are more submissive.
And so the nobles, officials, merchants, financiers and even some police commanders decide to form an alliance in a sect, a dark cult where the purpose of the followers is to destroy any source of knowledge and culture and scientific achievements.
Unfortunately the circumstances are in their favor because a coup d'état is expected due to the unexpected death of the King and the wife left alone without children is in danger of life.
THE danger is that this cult could dominate and take over the city.

PLOT

In the slums of the city lives a young girl named Maria, she supports herself by petty theft, one day she is discovered and immediately thrown in a cell in the city prisons.
At the same time, Maria's little brother Ray is kidnapped by a mysterious cult hiding under leather masks.
Fortunately, Maria meets Herbert, an ex-cop who helps her escape from the cell, passing through the city's basement.

Arrived on the road she discovers that not only her brother but also many other young boys have been kidnapped, determined to find out what's going on Maria collaborates with Herbert, her job is to sneak into a merchant's house to steal a mysterious code.
By deciphering this code it emerges that there is a secret society that wants to eliminate all the intellectual heritage of citizens.
Her research leads her to meet several people including some luminaries of science, who unfortunately have had to deal with the strong actions of the cultists, with the help of these Scientists Maria manages to sneak into a secret gathering and free all the children disappeared.
After this rescue they decide to enter the Royal Palace without being noticed , and finally manage to find out who is at the head of this secret sect : her name is Morgana , a former maid of the queen , because of her there was a coup d'état at court in which Maria's father lost his life.
Determined to avenge her father's death, Maria manages to overthrow the plot of the cult and embrace her dear brother Ray, while Herbert regains the trust of the queen who appoints him head of security and defender of science


PLAYABILITY

Well done graphics, smooth playability, quite long-lived.
There is a tutorial that guides us to the beginning of the story, we have a Diary (in the form of a roll) to consult where maps and useful information are collected.

We have a tender friend who always carries a nice ferret with us, when we don't know what to do click on him and he will show us a Hint.
There is no danger of getting stuck because in case of extreme need we can consult "The strategic guide"


There is no shortage of collectibles, sharpen your eyes because around you can collect gems of different colors, they will be placed in a nice box.
The protagonist is very skilled in disguises, you need to find everything you need and then we will use our skills to dress her, make her up, do her hair and transform her completely into another person.

The minigames are quite fun and can be easily overcome with a little effort, we will also have to be skilled at using lock picks, there is no fixed system you have to move everything until it lines up with the lock.
 The music fits the theme of the story.
I advise you to play it all to the end so you will unlock the Extras there is a bonus chapter where the story continues.

I recommend this "object finder" a well made product a long and pleasant storyline to play.

review:
This was a great adventure game from an indie developer. 

The only hidden object scenes in this hidden object adventure game were the 'costume' scenes where you gathered a bunch of seemingly random items and cobble together a disguise out of them to pass by a guard. I thought it was rather innovative in a genre that is pretty much usually the same. 

The story was about a cult that kidnapped your younger brother to sacrifice him to revive a dark god of some sort. There were many locations to visit in this fantasy medieval world, but was mainly a linear story with you having a few screens to explore, then moving on to the next area with the next set of screens. No map system where you could go anywhere like in a lot of these types of games. Graphics were really well done, and a lot of the puzzles in this one were pretty innovative rather than the same copy/paste puzzles I see in these types of games.

review:
[h1] Непонятные приключения Марлы [/h1]

[i] Fall of the New Age - квест-головоломка от украинской студии Shaman Games. Вышла в Steam в начале 2014 года и за все время собрала 55 отзывов, половина из которых - отрицательные. Как и почему так получилось - давайте разбираться. [/i] 

[u] [b] СЮЖЕТ [/b] [/u]

История рассказывается нам от лица девушки по имени Марла. Будучи пойманной на воровстве, она оказывается в одной из местных темниц, в то время как ее брата похищают неизвестные люди в масках. С помощью будущего сообщника по имени Герберт Марле удается сбежать. На "поверхности" она узнает, что ее младший брат Рэй был вовсе не единственным похищенным в городе ребенком. Что стоит за этими похищениями и какое отношение все это имеет к деятельности таинственного культа, активизировавшегося в последние дни - все это и предстоит выяснить нам с Вами в ходе прохождения. 

И сразу хочу озвучить претензию. Звучит все, конечно, в теории интересно, хоть и до избитости банально. Но проблема в том, как именно это подается. История в Fall of the New Age Premium Edition выглядит каким-то беспомощным придатком, манной кашей, остатки которой размазали по тарелке и пытаются выдать за полноценную еду. Все настолько затянуто и скучно, что Вам порой просто не захочется даже вникать в сюжетные диалоги, хоть разработчики и постарались сделать для них отдельные кинематографические вставки. 

[u] [b] ГЕЙМЛПЕЙ [/b] [/u]

Игровой процесс стандартен для подобного рода квестов. В основе - hog, оно же - поиск предметов, временами перемежающийся головоломками разной степени (нудности). Я вообще большой любитель посидеть над подобного рода развлечениями, но в этот раз мне удовольствие испортили. Поиска предметов здесь на удивление мало, еще меньше его в классическом стиле. Т.е. вместо стандартного поиска вещей "по списку" нам предстоит искать "по силуэтам". Процесс увлекательного розыска превращается в тупое прокликивание по всему, что видишь на экране, где за один клик вы можете задеть сразу по два-три предмета, не успев даже понять, что Вы вообще нашли. 

Решения, которых от нас ждут по мере самой сюжетной истории, тоже вызывают много вопросов. Вот нам дали большую кочергу, которой мы с успехом доставали предметы на любой высоте и расстоянии. Кочерга лежит у нас в инвентаре, но поддеть висящий на веревке предмет мы ей уже почему-то не можем. Для этого надо взять стрелу, поломать ее, и уже "искалеченным" древком выполнить то, что вполне логичнее было сделать все той же кочергой. И такого здесь - пруд пруди. Фокусы "с переодеванием", не несущие в себе вообще никакой сложности, мне и вовсе показались затягиванием времени. Среди головоломок была парочка забавных, но большая часть либо совершенно избиты и скучны, либо до ужаса просты. 

[u] [b] ИТОГ [/b] [/u]

Полное прохождение Fall of the New Age Premium Edition заняло у меня чуть более 4 часов. Из плюсов стоит отметить симпатичную рисовку и, как уже отмечал выше, сюжетные ролики, выполненные в кинематографическом стиле. Однако, ни то, ни другое не окупает общей скудности геймплея, затянутости прохождения и абсолютной скуки сюжетной линии. Русский язык изначально заявлен, но для его включения готовьтесь шаманить с бубном. Вдобавок к этому прибавьте ценник в 170р., и получите абсолютно невыгодное предложение. author: {'steamid': '76561198282752525', 'num_games_owned': 1267, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1593094361}
review:
这游戏好不好玩，看你是哪种玩家，传统解谜游戏玩家还是Hidden-objects游戏玩家。
前者玩这游戏，游戏不行；
后者玩这游戏，游戏不错。
用后者的视角玩下来，给我最大的惊喜是，没有为了解谜把弱智逻辑强加给玩家。

这里不得不解释一下HO游戏的弱智逻辑：
没有小刀拿不走桌上用胶带粘着的零件；
明明在逃亡主角却会因为怕脏不愿意去垃圾堆/灰堆里扒拉道具；
道具用完一次会丢掉接着在下一环节继续寻找新的同一作用的道具。
这种逻辑出现的本质是做这种游戏的工作室都是特别小型工作室，市场很小，想尽一切办法节省开支，不设计这种环节拖时间，卖不了多少钱，然而好好设计推理逻辑又太占时间，性价比低，只能按照这种死板的步骤一步步写程序做游戏。

本作这部分的设计，死板归死板，诚意也有诚意，能好好挖掘主角身份引出撬锁器弹弓装扮系统等的设定，编剧还写了一个比较符合常人逻辑的故事，虽然结尾拉胯了。
对于HO解谜游戏，实在是要求不高，不出戏的剧本，不折腾玩家的寻物，没有恶心玩家的弱智逻辑，是人都会觉得玩得轻松玩得愉快。

依旧是推荐给喜欢Hidden-Objects游戏的玩家。

author: {'steamid': '76561198284587961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1590919736}
review:
Ich empfehle dieses Spiel nur mit sehr starken Einschränkungen.
Übersetzungsfehler - wie man sie sonst von Artifex Mundi gewohnt ist - nehmen zum Schluss hin zu, im letzten, als Bonus getarnten Kapitel schon recht kräftig.
Warum man der Schürhaken das ganze Spiel mitschleppt, blieb mir ein Rätsel, kann man das Teil doch nicht als "Haken mit Griff" nutzen, obwohl es einer ist, auch nicht als "Haken". Man muss einen weiteren "Haken mit Griff" suchen sowie einen weiteren "Haken".
Als nervig unnötig habe ich das "Verkleidungsspiel" und auch das Schlösserknacken empfunden.
Persönlich stören mich immer die Fehler in der Storyline, wenn also z.B. bei einer "Mittelaltergeschichte" Gegenstände auftauchen, die unnötigerweise absolut nicht in dieses Zeitalter passen oder man muss was unnötigerweise machen, was eigentlich gerade nicht passt. Wenn man z.B. ganz leise sein sollte, dann wird man keine einsam auf der Wiese stehendes Pferd, gesattelt (! was für ein Unsinn) mit einem modernen (!) englischen Sattel, laut peitschenknallend antreiben, wenn es nur ein paar Schritte tun soll und der Feind ganz in der Nähe ist. Da passt einfach nichts. :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197768', 'num_games_owned': 3607, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1581500945}
review:
Fall of the New Age est un jeu si graphiquement est de bonne facture avec une ambiance et des personnages sympathiques (du moins pour les gentils), sa narration me laisse perplexe car c'est un véritable n'importe quoi dans les objets et leurs utilisations...

On peut citer la potion qui guérit tout... Tu est empoisonné la potion dr Charlatan te soigne, tu est au bord de la mort Dr Charlatan est toujours là, tu prend un coup sur la tête t'inquiètes pas dr Charlatan n'oublies pas.... Les limaces dont la bave perce les coffres, la scie à métaux avec sa lame faite par une arrête de poisson... 
Et on pourrait allonger la liste...

Et pourtant Fall of The New Age a de quoi séduire avec des SOC où on récupère des équipements pour se déguiser, des puzzles qui demandent de la réflexion à l'image du désamorçage de la bombe où il faut utiliser tous les chiffres présents en les additionnant ou les multipliant pour reconstituer les nombres du code, l'utilisation du lance-pierre même en étant basique (on dirige le viseur et dès que c'est vert on tire) est très agréable à jouer.

Mais, oui mais la narration avec ses utilisations incongrues met à mal l'histoire dont d'ailleurs personnellement je n'ai pas trop compris le pourquoi (rituel, explosions,...) des méchants (puisqu'au final le rejeton non reconnu du roi voulait sa place) et qu'ils arrivaient à se déplacer librement dans le château... Il suffisait de tuer le roi et pif-paf on n'en parle plus... 

Mais à vrai dire, à l'instar, de sa fin qui tombe comme un "truc" pas fini dans l'histoire principale et dont verra le dénouement dans le chapitre bonus, on se demande vraiment si il y a eu une véritable réflexion sur l'histoire complète ou si chaque scène est rattachée par une "bidouille" sortie de nulle part...

Pour en terminer avec ce commentaire, vous aurez une collection de petites pierres à trouver qui révèlent des parchemins... vides... un peu comme le jeu en lui-même pourrais-je dire ^^

review:
รีวิว Fall of The New Age Premium Edition

เป็นอีกหนึ่งเกม Hide & Seek คุณภาพอีกเกม ที่พยายามจะฉีกแนวทางการเล่นเดิมๆ เนื้อเรื่องเกี่ยวกับนางเอกที่เป็นโจร ต้องไปช่วยน้องชายที่ถูกลักพาตัวโดยลัทธิลึกลับ ซึ่งมีบุคคลลึกลับคอยช่วยเหลือนางเอกตลอดทาง 

ในเกมเราจะได้เห็นโจรคนหนึ่ง งัดความรู้ความสามารถออกมาใช้ นอกเหนือจากการเป็นตีนแมว ทั้งความรู้เรื่องคณิตศาสตร์ดาราศาสตร์ อาวุธยุทโธปกรณ์ การปรุงยา และการปลอมตัว ล้วนถูกนำมาใช้ในการหาของและแก้ปริศนาตามทางในเกมนี้ทั้งสิ้น โดยเฉพาะออปชั่นใหม่ที่ไม่เคยมีในเกมหาของมาก่อนอย่าง การปลอมตัว โดยนางเอกจะต้องลงมือเย็บชุดเองทั้งหมด แล้วใส่เพื่อผ่านทางไปต่อ ในเส้นทางที่มีทหารคอยคุม แล้วจะรู้ว่าการเป็น สุดยอดโจร นั้นไม่ง่ายเลย

ข้อเสียเพียงเล็กน้อยในเกมนี้นั่นคือ บั๊กที่ไม่สามารถหาทางไปต่อได้ในช่วงท้าย ทำให้ไม่สามารถจบเกมได้ และตรรกะในเกมหาของที่เขาลือกันว่ามันป่วย ก็ยังป่วยอีกตามเคย ชอบทำเรื่องง่ายให้เป็นเรื่องยาก ถ้ามีซักเกมเกิดคิดจะใส่ใจกับจุดนี้จริงๆ มันจะสามารถพลิกวงการ "เกมหาของ" ไปได้มากกว่านี้เลยนะ

author: {'steamid': '76561198043495274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1559394376}
review:
Ce jeu me divise, j’ai beaucoup de mal à trancher entre review positive et négative…parce que le scénario a du bon ! 

Il propose vraiment une excellente ambiance, de beaux décors, immersifs à souhait, des personnages aux objectifs logiques et cohérents, des cinématiques juste ce qu’il faut pour vous mettre dedans. 

Les rares SOC Scènes d’Objets Cachés correspondent à du shopping pour se grimer, le temps de trouver les accessoires nécessaires pour finir en atelier de bricolage pour reconstituer chaque partie du costume comme il convient…car en effet, la protagoniste est une championne du déguisement. De même que le fait de pouvoir user de la fronde contre nos adversaires. Original et sympathique !

Le reste est un peu redondant comme le principe du crochetage qui nécessite une prise en main douteuse et répétitive (parfois buguée ou c’est moi ?). Des moments de flop où on ne sait ni où aller ni que faire parce que soit les indications sont d’une évidence folle « si seulement j’avais une scie à métaux » ou à l’inverse totalement wtf ; sans compter un petit paquet d’allées et venues juste pour le petit truc qui manque tooouuuut là-bas. (l’absence de carte, donc de raccourci est à déplorer)

Puisqu’on trempe dans l’univers de l’espionnage, vous allez manger du message codé mais à mon grand dam, beaucoup m’ont semblée flous…c’est dommage parce que l’idée était séduisante. Tout comme cumuler des pierres pour délivrer des parchemins secrets…vierges !?! <= je n’ai pas compris l’intérêt du coffret spécial qui nous suit tout au long du jeu du coup. 

Un autre aspect négatif et non des moindres, la ceinture = barre d’inventaire est ultra sensible et s’active sans qu’on le souhaite vraiment alors qu’on essaie juste de revenir sur nos pas. Un tantinet agaçant à la longue…

La fin du chapitre principal tombe brutalement après 3h1/2 de jeu et l’aventure n’est clairement pas terminée, il faudra donc se diriger vers l’aventure bonus pour connaître la fin de ce périple. Pourquoi trancher le scénario de cette façon alors qu’on est au plein cœur de l’intrigue !?! 

Enfin bref, voilà, j’ai beaucoup aimé, il y a de l’idée et sincèrement s’il n’y avait pas tous ces petits aspects négatifs secondaires ce serait sans doute un grand OUI mais malheureusement il se présente trop brouillon à mon goût et c’est bien regrettable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997740965', 'num_games_owned': 8003, 'num_reviews': 2015, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1554030849}
review:
Привет, народ, а я прошел довольно качественную игру в жанре поиска предметов! Fall of the New Age Premium Edition тянет на крепкую 4рку из 5, но если бы сюжет был более гладким, то смело поставил бы 5рку. 
Игра действительно понравилась по многим пунктам. Отличное музыкальное сопровождение, очень приятные визуальные эффекты, красивые задники, интересные персонажи и конечно же залипательный сюжет. Сюжетная линия держала в заинтересованности всю игру, но ближе к середине случилась совершенно непонятная штука! В определенный момент я перестал понимать что происходит, почему главная героиня обзавелась определенными знаниями, выводами и информацией, но дальше сюжет вновь вошел в свое русло. Если когда-нибудь будете проходить данную игру, то поделитесь своим мнением по поводу этого момента (Этот разрыв произошел возле университета в игре). Возможно я упустил несколько деталей мимо себя, но все же припишу это к минусам Fall of the New Age Premium Edition. 
Сам игровой процесс знаком до безобразия, ибо удивлять в этом жанре безумно сложно, но вполне себе возможно! В игре есть несколько уникальных мини-игр, а еще обалденная идея с маскировкой. Самое главное, что все эти нововведения органично влились в происходящее, сгустили атмосферу смуты и заговором. Короче, друзья, если вы любите такие игры, то Fall of the New Age Premium Edition вас приятно удивит. 
Вообще данный разработчик делает отличные продукты. Я бы даже назвал их ААА играми своего жанра. Многие пользователи находили технические проблемы в играх этого автора, но лично я ничего подобного не видел. Желаю вам приятной игры! Хочу поблагодарить всех за отдачу и лайки, берегите нервы и избегайте шлака в магазине. 

Если понравился обзор, то приглашаю оценить и остальные: https://steamcommunity.com/id/rrombik/recommended/

review:
Начнем с того что заявленного русского языка в игре не было от слова совсем. Пришлось пошаманить с бубном чтобы хоть как-то, но он появился, естественно не без косяков, даже не так КОСЯКОВ. Половина всплывающих надписей вместо перевода выдает строку кода. Субтитры пояляются на долю секунды и сразу же исчезают, читайте как хотите в общем.
Баги, БАГИ, множество их картинка тормозит не успевая за звуком, головоломки лагают, взаимодействие с предметами не работает. Под конец в бонусной миссии вообще пропадает возможность закончить игру. Мы тратим все предметы из инвентаря плюс взаимодействие с объектами перестает работать. 
В общем никому не рекомендую за свои кровные ЭТО покупать.

review:
So I'm normally a fan of these games, but this one is... not good.

First up the story - whilst it's a fairly standard female protangonist rescuing someone (in this case a little brother) in a race against time it is horribly badly translated. I mean maybe it made more sense and sounded good in its original language but the english translation is terrible and you can hear the voice actors struggling to turn the mangled corspses of sentences into something half way decent (a few just ignore the given lines and go with something that works which just creates more dissonance since they then don't match with the subtitles). The story is verging on that "so bad it's unintentionally good" thing.

Well I could forgive the story if the gameplay was solid and it must be said that it is nicely animated (mostly) but that really doesn't make up for its flaws. It has basic point n click elements coupled with puzzle minigames and two types of HO scenes. The point n click items are mostly standard, the puzzles come in three flavours - your brain is not needed, easy and lastly terrible implementation, with the solves being along the lines of click/wiggle the mouse randomly, through to easy solves, through to puzzles that you will want to break not because of their difficulty but because of their unfriendly interfaces. 

The hidden object scenes also are divided into shadows where you are hunting for items for a disguise which basically boil down to "click everything on the screen" and password scenes where you are given a large number of items of a similar type (eg animals) and then required to find a short list of specific ones.

Unfortunately both type suffer from animation lag so if you click a ssecond item while the collect animation for the first one if still playing it won't register it.

The end of the story is in the extras that are unlocked when you finish the main game but this is not obviously signposted (as you can tell by the number of people complaining about the abrupt ending).

It also features the strangest sounding cat I've ever encountered in a game.

On the plus side you will never get stuck despite it being ridiculously picky about click points for certain things because the game features not only a hint system but a full walkthrough that is accessible at any time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960931103', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1535557993}
review:
[b]Pros[/b]
+60FPS
+Nice scenery / art
+Didn’t run into any bugs

[b]Cons[/b]
+Tons of grammar / spelling mistakes
+Poor voice acting
+No explanation for puzzles (maybe this was just b/c I played on hard?
+Long and boring scrolls you unlock
+Too easy
+”Click everywhere” strategy for HO scenes

As for the expected content in a HOG, you have the classic “save someone” storyline, some HO scenes and puzzles. The story is hard to grasp as the storytelling is poor. The HO scenes are just ok. I mainly resorted to clicking randomly on objects that seemed out of place. There were also some reverse HO scenes where you are given a shadow of the object and need to find it. Going back to clicking everywhere seemed to get most of the items.

The lock picking puzzles can all be solved by moving your mouse in a circle rapidly on each level of the lock pick, no strategy needed. I was playing the game on hard with no hints, etc., however, the game wouldn’t even tell you the objective of a puzzle. I feel like this basic instruction can still be left in.

There are also a lot…and I mean a lot of grammar and spelling errors. The voiceovers are below average. 

One thing worth mentioning is all the little stones you collect. They are used to unlock scrolls which tell about various things of the time. The odd part is that they are so long and boring that it makes you laugh and ends up not serving any purpose. Why were these even included?

Lastly, [spoiler]when you finally save your brother, [/spoiler] the game abruptly puts you back to the main menu with no closure to the story. You must go back and click “Play” AGAIN to do the final chapter. Why?! Just a bizarre choice from the devs.


[b]Conclusion[/b]
Too many problems push this over into the “not recommended” category except for those diehard HOG fans.

[b] 3/10[/b] Poor

Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Walk click/HO hybrid with linear but decent plot. 3 hours total. Good puzzle variety. Solid hint system. Ends abruptly. Not worth a replay.

This is a game in which you do lockpicking, collect disguise pieces, do alchemy, and fix the odd machinery piece. There is a plot centered around stopping middle age terrorists of some strange variety, there seems to be a plot against the queen. 

What game is there is actually one of the more enjoyable, logically sound, well presented hidden object games I have played thus far. The quality of the art actually seems to improve by the end game, with subtle lighting effects and more use of color palettes than the early sequences.

The casualization makes it near impossible to stay stuck. You can skip harder puzzles and the hint system does work on a timer and can be summoned nearly at will with a cute animation to boot. The voice acting and animations are somewhat common and help bring the NPCS to life.

Conclusion: Due to its solid core mechanics, the walk clicker hybridization, the cool sort of wealthy and civilized protrayal of the middle ages with advanced astronomy, steampunk like engineering and the odd dash of magic, this makes for a compelling game setting. The garrett/thief type protagonist was likeable and made you feel like you were using the environment to sidestep the obstacles on the road. Good job overall and will likely hold on to this title as one of the better examples of the genre until I have too many highly polished titles to pick from and then, and only then, would consider discarding it in favor of superior titles. Since I have already beaten the game and the replay value is fairly low.

Note: Seems based on screenshots and store images that the games does continue past the rescue of the brother. Maybe my game just booted back to menu and I thought it was game over. Apparently you must go TO EXTRAS. and PRESS PLAY FROM EXTRAS MENU TO GET REAL ENDING + BONUS CHAPTER>

The bonus chapter adds a new disguise a small area with another collection of puzzles and a an ending that mostly ties all loose ends neatly. It also gives another collection of easter egg stones like the ones from the main portion of the game which when unlocked, allow you to get a bunch of loredump pages about the setting and the world. Nice touch. About 45 minutes playtime extra.

review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

"Fall of the New Age" Premium Edition is a Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. The game was developed by Shaman Games Studio and published by PlayRix.

Since this is a premium edition game, it comes with extra features that are not available in its' counterpart; standard edition.

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention that the visuals in the game are well done. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are two different difficulty game modes to choose from: Regular and Expert.

The scroll keeps track of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is a map in the game. But it is not given immediately at the start of the game.

The disguise box is frequently used to trick the guards to by-pass them.

The jeweled box contains knowledge of the Kingdom. There are five scrolls locked in their compartments. The slots on the compartments are for the gemstones. These gemstones are scattered throughout the game for you to find.

There is a padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary.

There are some interactive items in the game. Some of these interactive items may require extra components before they can interact with. All interactive items are marked with a symbol in one of the corners.

The hidden object scenes consist of the following: Shadow items and Traditional word lists. Some of these hidden object scenes may require little or no interaction.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them.

Since this is a premium edition, it has a bonus chapter, but it can be accessed only after the main story is completed.

Miscellaneous

The extra features: Bonus Chapter; Wallpapers; Concept Art; Soundtrack; Screen Saver. The extra content cannot be accessed until the entire game is completed.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. The replay value for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.

review:
Neat HO game with nice graphics and character animations and voicing. Liked the story set in the Middle Age and the lore was quite interesting to piece together, one puzzle at a time. After you finish the game and *spoiler* save your brother from the cult, you get a new chapter in the extras where you *spoiler* save your brother from the cult. But this is still a very good HO game from a great team who did amazing along various plots and settings in their other games.

My favorite of all things about this game would be, for the first time ever, that you have to disguise yourself with useful trinkets found nearby in order to progress in the story. Quite unexpected but fit really well with the theme of the thief on a secret mission. Additionally, you find stones here and there throughout the game that unlock some bonus text and make you extra careful in order not to not miss one.

All in all, I really liked this game and I can only recommend it! It is worth its full price but if you still need another reason, get the Dollar Mystic Bundle from Fanatical website!

review:
I enjoyed this. It's different to other HOG games. It's part point and click, part hidden object, the puzzles are simple but varied. The voice acting is a bit mixed, some of it is awful, some of it is ok. I see they left it open for a sequel and I'd play that sequel if it followed the same format as this game. I did get this as part of a bundle, I honestly didn't expect it to be anything special, so I was surprised by how much I actually enjoyed playing this, and if I had paid the full price (£4.99 at the time of writing (not on sale)) I'd still be happy with the game I played. The only thing I didn't like was the main story ended so abruptly, it was like being suddenly kicked back to reality, at the start of the bonus chapter there's a flashback scene, which I think should have been the actual ending. The bonus chapter I also enjoyed and it ends the story nicely. The main ending is my only complaint about this game though.
I ran this on win7 and had no problems with it at all. You may want to check out some of the other reviews if you're running it on a different OS though.

review:
这个游戏是挂机闲来没事点点玩的，作为解谜游戏的爱好者，这款游戏还是挺惊喜的，玩多了A社千篇一律的游戏后，这个游戏还有那么一点小清新！

先说说这个游戏的优点：
前期剧情搭配过场CG，氛围营造的还是不错，比较有沉浸感。
小谜题搭配的也和剧情和谐，不像有些解谜游戏一言不合就莫名其妙地玩小游戏。
有一些场合需要化妆的小游戏算是亮点，但是可惜没有太多深度，只是需要点点点就能完成。

再来说说缺点：
游戏优化不是很好，经常换场景有很明显的卡顿，有点让人心烦。
开锁设计的毫无乐趣和挑战，还要不停地开各种锁。
作为解谜游戏没有地图快速切换特别的不友好。
游戏内的提示简直智障，基本等于没用，好在自带攻略，可以查阅。

剧情上的槽点就更多了，尤其结尾很有虎头蛇尾的感觉，但是还是不剧透了，那个大叔全程让个小姑娘来做事不觉得羞愧吗！？

author: {'steamid': '76561198132471057', 'num_games_owned': 1274, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1506778176}
review:
Surprisingly good and fun! I don't really have much opinion on the story, it wasn't my cup of tea much but it certainly did pick up the hype by Chapter 2!

PROS:
> Graphics were pretty good, widescreen backgrounds are always appreciated
> Had a lot of extras included!
> I really loved the disguise minigames and the stone collection
> I appreciate the attention to detail by providing extra information on alchemy and the dark ages
> Some HO scenes were really relaxing and refreshing, they put a spin to it that made it a lot more enjoyable
> The puzzles were entertaining as usual which I really have to give kudos to Shaman Games (I enjoyed the hourglass puzzle)
> Built-in strategy guides are always a friend!

CONS:
> The (true) HO scenes had some effort put into it although it did get a bit cluttered/low quality towards the end
> The game suffered a bit of backtracking and getting lost/being unsure what to do since sparkles were not very frequent, Marla's diary was also pretty vague in terms of hints
> It usually takes place in dark-ish dim locations so there aren't a lot of pretty looking visuals ALTHOUGH I did love the university and the library! (But it was the dark ages, I don't think they could have done much to make it nice, haha!)

Overall, I think I'm becoming a very good supporter of Shaman Games, much like Gogii. The level of thought they put into their games is really pleasing and I admire their love for their creations. Definitely a good buy for me!

To dość nietypowa gra HOG, co samo w sobie skazuje ją na sporo negatywów.
1. Samych ukrytych obiektów jest mało, w dodatku są fatalnie zrealizowane bo trzeba przewijać pasek by wiedzieć czego szukać
2. Gra przerosła autorów, jest tu masa kombinacji bardziej znanych z przygodówek (i niby super jak dla mnie...), fajnie bo nie trzeba chodzić, niestety jakaś połowa w ów połączeń ma mało sensu, czasem wcale. Efekt - po przejściu gry cieszyłem się że ja ukończyłme i równie mocno że to koniec tej irytującej gry....
3. Łamigłówki - jest ich mało, ale są całkiem dobre, zdecydowanie na plus.
4. Ciekawa historia, ładnie zrealizowana
5. Ładna grafika
6. Przeciętny voice acting, ni plus, ni minus
7. Słabe "hints", że nie wspomnę że zanim sie zwierzak uruchomi i coś wskaże to mija z 4-5 sekund,. Nie wolno tak traktować gracza.

Gra ma oceny "mieszane" i niestety w pełni na nie zasługuje. Gdyby miała pozytywy to dałbym jej minusa, ale że ma mieszane to tylko i wyłącznie dlatego ma plus.

review: Un gioco davvero notevole e longevo, ma pieno di gravi difetti per chi come me ha un Mac con gli ultimi sistemi operativi (io utilizzo iMac OS X El Capitan). Indubbiamente, le immagini e le sequenze cinematiche sono di grande valore, direi persino “barocche” per la ricchezza dei dettagli e l’impatto visivo. Le scene con oggetti nascosti non deludono e sono collegate ai travestimenti che la protagonista deve utilizzare per procedere nel suo percorso, mentre i mini-giochi sono invitanti. Nel complesso, una storia lineare e valida, che si conclude nell’avventura bonus e lascia aperta la possibilità di un seguito. Per quanto riguarda le pesanti note dolenti riferite a Mac, dico solo che ci vuole MOLTA PAZIENZA perché i “bug” sono tantissimi e davvero fastidiosi, a partire dal sonoro limitato alle musiche e senza dialoghi, fino ad arrivare agli oggetti raccolti rappresentati su Mac con icone di programmazione e ad una schermata di programmazione che rimane fissa sulle scene (solo per citarne alcuni). Ho segnalato tutto ciò agli sviluppatori, ma senza ottenere risposta. Quindi, mi sento di consigliarlo, ma per chi ha Mac e non ha pazienza… No! Peccato davvero!

review: Mac version is glitchy...maybe PC version is better? This game has the most beautiful graphics and animation. author: {'steamid': '76561198172454749', 'num_games_owned': 2937, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1478927583}
review:
[h1]나름대로 참신 요소와 한글화 등 빅피쉬게임과는 차별화되는 재미가 있는 HOG[/h1]

히든 오브젝트 게임 중에 타게임에 비해선 인지도나 게임의 퀄리티 등은 다소 마이너하다.
하지만, 먼저 한글화가 된 점과 본 게임만의 참신한 요소가 있어서 본 게임을 추천한다.

히든 오브젝트 게임사 중 제일 큰 빅피쉬게임즈는 한글화를 전혀 안해주는 반면, 본 게임의 게임사는 그나마 한글화를 잘 해주는 편이다. 본게임사에서 스팀에 출시해놓은 게임들 중에 절반 정도는 한글화를 내놨다.
다른 HOG와는 다르게 게임내에서 변장을 하는 요소가 있어 그런 점은 참신함이라 할수 있다.

다만, 아쉬움 점은 한글화임에도 숨은그림찾기를 할때 찾아야 할 항목이 하단부에 보이지않는다.
이런 문제는 어쩔수 없이 게임을 종료하고 영문으로 실행한 다음 플레이해야 하는 번거러움이 있다.

그리고, 이 게임사의 경우도 빅피쉬와 마찬가지로 부가적인 서비스에 인색한 편이다.
도전과제와 트레이딩 카드를 넣어놓지 않았다는 점.

이런걸 제외하고는 전체적인 플레이타임도 꽤 긴편으로 메인쳅터만 적어도 3~4시간은 걸린다.
게다가 보너스 챕터까지 합치면 넉넉 잡아서 5시간은 플레이해야 엔딩을 볼수 있다.
게임의 스토리나 그래픽은 뛰어나지는 않지만 괜찮은 수준이다.




전체적으로 평점 70점의 HOG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125664030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1475487642}
review:
通关撒花：新世纪的降临，一款点击解谜游戏，与D社那种制作精美的作品无法比拟，但也比A社某些粗制滥造的寻物游戏要强。

游戏分为主线和附加剧情，共11章，流程在3-4小时左右，略短了些。无卡牌无成就，大多数拥有的好友仅仅是拿来+1而已。平心而论，游戏算不上出彩，但也有自己的特色。

主要玩法依然是搜集物品和解开谜题，但没有层出不穷的单纯寻物场景，每个寻物场景都有着与之对应的目的：进行不同的变装。女主需要乔装改扮，混入不同的地方获取情报，因此需要拿到用于变装的物品。变装这个设定很有创意，也让游戏更加有趣。

游戏自带提示和笔记，同时还内置攻略集。笔记会自动写下种种与解谜相关的线索，留待玩家回头查找。因此，并不会出现卡关的情况，个别谜题需要动动脑子，实在解不开也可以等待一段时间选择跳过，休闲性十足。

总体来说算是+1游戏里面很不错的一款作品，拿来休闲一下还不错。虽没有出色的剧本，但闲来无事也可以一玩。

review:
Fall of the New Age is an adventure puzzle game set in the early Renaissance period where the pursuit of knowledge and application of logic are emerging as the way forward. You play as a young thief on a mission to save her brother from a nefarious cult whose ultimate goal is to halt this progress and return the world to one steeped in ignorance and superstition. You are aided in your mission by a mysterious stranger who is working against the cult. Unfortunately it doesn't get much deeper than this, but then it is a quick and casual game.

With regards to actual gameplay, Fall of the New Age is part adventure, part hidden object game. You will search beautifully painted scenes for objects to solve puzzles and progress the story/access new areas. There are a number of minigames throughout to break things up a bit/add some variety, and there are cutscenes as you transition from one area to the next to help progress the story.

I enjoyed Fall of the New Age for the most part - as others have said, it's a good game to play if you want some game time but don't want to play anything particularly taxing. The artwork is lovely, as is the music. The story is.. somewhat lacking, but there at least. The puzzles themselves shouldn't give you too much grief. Overall, it was an enjoyable way to spend a handful of hours. If you're a fan of hidden object games (or not averse to them and looking for a casual game to add to your library for some gaming down time), then I'd recommend Fall of the New Age. It's not amazing, but it's not bad either.

(I received this in a steamcrate bundle ..and left it open for an hour or so while preparing dinner.)

review:
A short and nice casual point-and-click adventure, with a few innovative thievery features: lock-picking, dressing up in costumes, and using slingshots. Unfortunately, these features are all very casual indeed: dressing up especially involves no real gameplay. Expect an especially casual experience.

There are a handful of hidden-object scenes, too, but it's really not a hidden-object game.

The animations are good, but the voice acting is very bad--perhaps due to the actors struggling with an awkward English script). Still, everything comes together to move the story along well enough.

Nothing amazing here, but it's pleasant enough for a thumbs up.

WARNING: Even though the game claims to support Linux, support is very bad. It would not save my game. I restarted it again in Windows and was able to play through without problems.

Partirà così alla ricerca del fratello e durante il cammino, con l'aiuto di Herbert, scoprirà di essere finita in una cospirazione che la setta sta pianificando in segreto.
Il gioco si sviluppa in undici capitoli, ogni ambiente è ben curato e l'interazione è ottima, belli i disegni ed i colori, enigmi vari mai troppo difficili, buone anche le musiche. Un peccato è non poter cambiare la risoluzione fissa a 720p e anche i filmati potevano essere migliorati. Nel complesso ne risulta una storia piacevole e scorrevole completabile più o meno in una decina di ore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971047607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1469794859}
review:
I really wish Steam had a "meh" option.
Fall of the New Age Premium Edition is a HOG-lite puzzle adventure game from a studio that shows a lot of potential. Having previously played Namariel Legends: Iron Lord Premium Edition also by Shaman Games, (which was excellent by the way,) I had high hopes for Fall of the New Age. Some were met, some weren't.

The Good.
Great art style, graphics and cutscenes, as good if not better than the best offerings of the more established studios in the genre.
The sound effects and soundtrack fit the story.
The story for the first 66% of the game is very good, then it starts to get lazy.
Lots of puzzles.
Interesting game mechanics regarding the use of a slingshot, having to don various disguises, and a mix of both standard HO scenes and scenes that require you to find object outlines.

The Bad.
Bugs. Two puzzles were impossible to complete because the objects I needed to drag got stuck. Restarting had the same problem. (Windows 7 64bit) 
Two cut scenes were in the wrong order, with a soldier I discover in a stables asking where his money is, and when I get the money and try to give it to him a few minutes later, it then launches the correct scene, where I run into him for the first time and the cutscene shows I know him and he asks for money if I want his help.
There are some jewels you pick up, you need 3 parts, I found 2, I never found the third, there's even a gate that requires all three parts. They are never used and you never need to open the gate. You end the game with 2/3 jewels in your inventory.
While the story begins strongly you soon realise it's the usual rescue a friend/family member with supernatural elements .... why do HOGs rarely try something original?
The game is too easy! The puzzles almost autosolve in a lot of cases, the lockpicking scenes are move a pin at random until a hole appears, and the point and click is incredibly simple with most objects required for progress found in the same scene or very near it. An experienced HOG player won't find much challenge in this game.
The "Premium Edition" adds a bonus chapter, in Namariel Legends, it was almost an hour long, original, and added to the story. I expected the same here .... nope, the "bonus" chapter is simply the final chapter. It feels as though the developer simply cut the last chapter from the game, leaving it unfinished, just so they could add it back as a "premium edition with bonus content." If you don't play the bonus chapter, the game ends mid-story ... the bad guys get to carry out their evil plan, and almost everything you did up to that point is meaningless. Your inventory even carries over into the bonus chapter! It's not a bonus chapter, it's the final act!

The problem with Fall of the New Age is that it's all icing and no cake. It looks great, it sounds great, the cutscenes are awesome, the story begins well, and then you discover that there's very little substance behind it. The storyline is generic, the game/puzzles aren't challenging, The voice acting is terrible. The game places you in an urgent life or death situation on 3 occasions and then waits for you to tour the town, have a few conversations, solve a few puzzles, and then eventually get back to the point where an executioner still has his axe raised over your brother's head, the librarian is still lying in the burning building, or the  chemist is still coughing out his last breath after being poisoned! It's not a terrible game, but it falls incredibly short of Namariel Legends.

review:
This is a Hidden Object Game that's light on hidden objects and works much better as an adventure-lite. You arrive on the scene as the terrible Cultists are taking over the kingdom, blowing up monuments and killing the wise. You might not ordinarily get involved, but your brother is snatched while he’s working as lookout for a burglary you’re busy committing, and now you want to get him back before he’s sacrificed in the terrible endgame Ritual.

There’s a swashbuckling feel to the game, though you won’t actually swashbuckle very much, and you’re helped by the dashing Herbert, a Musketeer type who rescues you from time to time and moves you through the chapters. Overall it keeps a good tone, with some English-as-a-second-language illuminations, a nice graphical feel, and an awkward bit of time dilation at the end - a calamitous event is about to take place, and you will take a break to make a tool and go retrieve an errant handle from someplace down the way before the event finally happens. Life during gametime.

An interesting but underplayed mechanic is the introduction of disguises. As you move through the world you’ll need to pretend to be people you aren’t in order to get past guards and infiltrate locations; while this looks at first like it’s going to be really interesting, ultimately it’s just a matter of clicking through hidden objects. There’s also a tendency to drop you into puzzles without explaining what the goals are, but this all works out in the end.

I enjoyed this. Main story beaten; extra-muros history and background comes via scrolls that are unlocked by jewels you collect in your travels, and somehow I managed to miss enough of those that I didn’t unlock the final set of notes. After 6+ hours saving the realm, I can live with that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025632123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1465098944}
review:
Fall of the New Age is one of those games that make me wish steam reviews had a "mixed" option. As others have said, it's undoubtedly a HOG- or at least a casual adventure game, since actual hidden object sequences are refreshingly few and far between. It doesn't appear to be made with the same engine as many of the other HOGs on steam, making for some nice little changes to the formula. Another plus is that all the art is original- no collections of cobbled-together photo assets here.

It starts out with a bang, treating you to a bombastic (for the genre) 3D animated cutscene, then deposits you into a prison cell to escape from as your tutorial, like so many other medieval fantasy games. I'm not ashamed to admit, I was reasonably pumped up to begin playing. 

As I proceeded, however, my enthusiasm began to trickle away. The plot, while fairly generic, seemed decent, but I found myself struggling to get a hold on it, since the storytelling was done EXTREMELY poorly. The localiztion is awful as well- almost all the dialogue is phrased awkwardly or incorrectly, and the characters' grasp on the english language seems to get looser as the game progresses. Furthermore, the subtitles often aren't quite the same as what the characters are saying, and the mouth animations match up worse than a kung-fu dub. Voice acting is acceptable in some cases and hilariously bad in others. The 3D cutscenes are reasonably impressive for a game like this, but the animation is often blocky and goofily exaggerated, and some of the character models look pretty bad. 

Gameplay is alright, although some (not all) of the puzzles were more obnoxious than I'm used to- I skipped a couple of them. I found myself resorting to the hint button more than normal as well, in part because it was often difficult to tell a small 'active' area apart from the scenery. There are several puzzles that actually require you to write down a sequence of weird symbols to enter into a later combination lock. Sometimes these are recorded into your diary, but that takes up the entire screen when you open it and sometimes even resets puzzles, so you may as well just write them all down. There are some other complaints I had about specific puzzles, but most of them can safely be grouped under the general "obnoxious" gripe I mentioned above.

The game is rife with tiny quasi-bugs, like expository text popping up at the wrong time. For the most part they can be overlooked, although I was briefly stuck at least twice when the hint button pointed me toward a puzzle that the game wouldn't let me solve because I hadn't yet seen the solution key. The game also crashed once. 
The biggest issue I ran into, however, was at the end of chapter 4, when you [spoiler]rescue your brother[/spoiler]. A small cutscene played, and I was abruptly shunted back to the main menu where a popup told me I had completed the game. I was rather incredulous, since the story really hadn't been wrapped up, even though I did technically accomplish my character's original objective. After checking the bonus features to see if there was any extra bits of gameplay, I chalked it up to more of the bad storytelling I mentioned earlier, and headed to the store page to write a review. 
However, right as I began to write, I noticed a couple screenshots in the store slideshow that I had never seen during my playthrough. My belief that I had somehow missed the end of the game reaffirmed, I booted it back up(once again being assured that I had completed the game) and tried pressing "play" again, which finally allowed me to play the final chapter.

While the game is definitely not overtly bad, and offers some refreshing differences from many other HOGs on steam, there are unfortunately too many rough patches for me to give this a recommendation. I would, however, like to see more from this studio, hopefully with a little more polish.

review:
[i]Fall of the New Age[/i] is a neat little game coming from Shaman Games, a promising Ukrainian HOG developer team that we already know from titles like [i]Dreamscapes[/i] series earlier last year. Originally developed for iOS systems, this game is a beautiful time kill for a tiresome after work evening when you'd prefer having some gaming time yet do not necessarily want to be heavy on the attention span.

Our story takes place in a fictional Late Medieval - Early Renaissance period, where people start to leave old superstitions aside for the sake of science, logical thinking and societal progress. The death of the kingdom's benevolent king marks an ill omen for the future though: mysterious disappearances among orphaned children; raids on libraries, ateliers, workshops and academies; assaults on scientists, alchemists and philosophers begin. An ominous cult with the motto "ignorance is power" jeopardizes the promise and knowledge of the new age. Within all this chaos, Marla - a street urchin and a young thief - finds her young brother taken by the cult. With the aid of a swash-buckling mentor, Marla will try to stop conspiracies of the cult and find her brother by all means!

I know, I know... HOGs carry a tendency to reinterpret classical tales, movies or successful video games in their own paces. Here, we have a simplified version of the original [i]Thief[/i] game, with a tense dynamic between enlightenment and ignorance, plus political power plays on the side. Nope, that sincerely doesn't make [i]Fall of the New Age[/i] a bad game at all. There isn't much depth to it surely, but it’s a fun time kill. You just have to be aware of your expectations about it.

Artworks are alright, with suitably fitting medieval atmospheres and beautiful alchemical designs for puzzles. Character models and 3D animations work fine - even though characters themselves are nothing original. It was also a bonus that the game had somewhat decent voice acting. Esthetically, it is a decent game: not horrible, not spectacular either.

The gameplay is completely different than what we'd be accustomed to as a HOG. The game carries HOG dynamics - like puzzles, item collection, environment interaction etc. - yet without much HOG gameplay actually. There are 4-5 scenes where you'll be expected to find some random symbols from a list for a password or some items scattered around which can be used as a costume for Marla, in her various disguises. It was refreshing to see a dynamic explanation and use for HOG sequences for the story. A cute and welcoming change, indeed.

There are some reports for the Mac version not working properly - voice acting missing or item graphics not showing up properly - but I encountered no problems while playing this on Windows 7, so I cannot account for other systems. All in all, grab it on sale for a silent afternoon to have a decent time kill.

review:
Another easy casual game with a cheesy storyline but quite good fun to play.

Fall of the New Age is a slightly above average casual game. It is similar to so many others out there in that the story is barebones and the main focus is on finding objects to unlock the next puzzle.

The story does not go into much depth but as far as I could gather, a cult of some sort has taken over the town and you play a heroine out to rescue her brother who was kidnapped. We do not get any information about the beliefs of the cult or how it came about / where it recruited its members from etc, though there is a brief scene with a strange sorceress at a later point. There is basically no back story to any of the characters, you just land in the middle of it all and off you go to solve the mini puzzles.

The graphics are lovely and the atmosphere is fitting. The medieval scenes are very pretty indeed.

The music is pleasant enough and there is one piece with almost Gregorian voices, though that one doesn't last for long and we're back to the blander stuff.

Voice work is fair enough, though I laughed at the voice of a small child in a cage above a fire (perhaps in for a roasting?), who sounded so calm, bored and unemotional and not at all relieved that he was about to be rescued. The player's main ally is an incredibly lazy chap who gives all the hard work and running around to the player (a much younger female), while he relaxes with some wood whittling or a map or simply hangs around outside some castle gates to enjoy the night air.

The puzzles are mostly very easy and the main challenge is wondering where to go next. Scouring for objects necessary and does take a while. Some of the puzzles are ridiculously easy, like the many many times the player has to pick a lock, but others are slightly more challenging, such as a maths puzzle and a cog wheel. Overall there is a decent balance of puzzles.

There were very few hidden object scenes and they weren't the traditional type. It was a case of matching objects to shadows. This actually came as a relief as I have started to find standard hidden object scenes tedious in games.

So I enjoyed the game and it took me about 6 hours to complete. There is a choice of 3 settings at the beginning so I guess playing it on its easiest setting would be faster than 6 hours as there would be no searching for the next object but the player would be lead by sparkles.

review:
Vorwort:

Du reist in diesem spannenden Abenteuer Fall of the New Age zurück ins finstere Mittelalter und schlüpfst in die Rolle der jungen Meisterdiebin Marla. Du bist mit Ray – deinem kleinen Bruder – auf Beutezug, wobei du ganz unverhofft Zeuge eines scheußlichen Opfer-Rituals wirst.

Doch plötzlich werdet ihr von finsteren Gestalten überfallen und du wachst in einem Kerker wieder auf. Dein kleiner Bruder ist spurlos verschwunden! 

Auf deiner Reise erwarten Dich viele Rätsel und Wimmelbilder die es zu entdecken gibt, diese gibt es widerum zu lösen, um hinter das Geheimnis einer tiefgründigen Verschwörung kommen, die hier herrscht und deinen vermissten Bruder zu retten.  Desweiteren ist es von der Handlung und vom Aufbau wirklich mal was ganz anderes (Verkleidungen suchen und zusammen basteln), dass gibts nur hier ! Selbst die Minispiele haben teilweise einen hohen Anspruch .  Für alle die aber ein wenig Hilfe benötigen, für die steht ein Hilfebutton bereit, dieser lädt sich nach Benutzung nach einer gewissen Zeit wieder auf.

Pro:

+ spannende Orte, die es zu entdecken gibt
+ viele Minispiele und Rätsel die es zu lösen gibt
+ atemberaubende 3D-Videosequenzen
+ mittelalterliche Welt
+ Extras die sich freischalten lassen

Kontra:

- kurze Spielzeit von ca. 3 Stunden 

Fazit:

" Fall of the New Age " bietet ein Gesamtpacket aus detaillierte Grafik, Hollywood reifen Filmsequenzen und überdachter Story. Dieses Abenteuer ist für Anfänger oder auch Experten geeignet, die dieses Genre mögen oder gerne kennen lernen möchten.

This game barely has a storyline, and that which does exist doesn't make sense half of the time. The ending was very abrupt and left me feeling like nothing was resolved. 
[spoiler] I rescue my brother, but the cult leader just runs away with the rest of the bad guys. The End??? [/spoiler] 
I just found the "bonus chapter" in the extras section. Why it's a "bonus" and not just the normal end of the game, I have no clue!!

I had to reference the in game guide several times because it turns out the next step required made no logical sense. Here's a good example: you have a fire poker, a lever and a hair clip in your inventory... what do you use to pry a bowling ball (?) out of a roof gutter? Answer: [spoiler] it's the hair clip! Seriously... [/spoiler]

I can't recommend this game (especially for the price) when there are so many other hidden object & point/click games which are more fun.

review:
[h1]Short version: 77%[/h1]
Fall of the New Age is a typical hidden object game… without the actual hidden object parts. Still, as a casual level adventure, it has an exciting enough story.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Fall of the New Age– made by upcoming Ukrainian indie developer Shaman Games– is sort of a lightweight version of the Thief series: you play as a burglar who winds up in a conspiracy devised by the evil Cult against the current power structure and their knowledge-based system in favour of a religious dictatorship. With a mandatory kidnapped relative and a swashbuckling mentor just to complete a few clichés.
Still, the story is sufficiently exciting and has a good pace, the characters are interesting… and for this price range this is a lot more than anyone can want.

As for gameplay… well, this one is not really a hidden object game. There are a few segments where you look for symbols, and some rummaging for clothes, but no traditional scenes, at all.
There is a larger focus on the point ‘n’ click style elements instead, which, for the most part, gives just enough challenge to turn the game into a nice, casual, lazy, one-afternoon relaxation.

review:
This game is annoyingly broken.  Instead of inventory items, most of the time what appears in your inventory is a generic tool icon, a placeholder for the actual graphic of the item-- you know, the kind of thing that might exist during game development.  And constantly, and I do mean constantly, there are error logs that appear in the top third of the screen.

If the game ran perfectly, I'd probably rate it around a 5/10.  There's no voice acting in cut scenes where it seems strange that there's not-- almost like it's another game error, but I assume it has more to do with game budget.  And the puzzles are incredibly simple and without any challenge.  There are hidden object type scenes where you need to pick up almost everything in the scene, so you could get 95% of the objects just by clicking around at everything on the screen.  The idea that you're trying to find items to use as part of a disguise is a pretty ingenious one, but the execution of that idea is badly done, and the "hidden object" part of it needs to be much improved.

I would enjoy the game somewhat, despite it's simplicity, simply because I enjoy these types of games-- but the constant (although not game-breaking) bugs just suck all enjoyment out of the game.  The game does have a little character to it, and the backgrounds and environments are beautifully rendered.  But because of the bugs, I lower my score to a 2/10.

review:
If you can get this game in a bundle or very cheap in a sale and you are absolutly into Hidden obejct and very basic point and click adventure, than this game might be something for you,.

Gameplay wise the game really doesn't have much to offer, other than  "Click around untill you find every Hitbox and than use the obvious item", which cna lead to frustratingly combing screens for  some kind of Reaction form the pointer, but sometimes the hitboxes are so close to each other that you will always miss one, for example I ahd to look up one item that was hidden right next to another one, because I didn't know the hidden itemw as there, I always assumed the buttonprompt send me to the other Item I did not need yet.

Than if you are stuck the hintsystem seems absolutly useless, it send me in between screens, instead of hinting towards the area to search, if it gives you a hint, it should not point away from the screen I need to find the enxt item to continue, thats bloody idiotic.

The sounds and music are ok, the vocie acting is uhh rather amateurish, the puzzles are mostly obvious and only a few minigames where you either hunt for hidden objects or you need to do some other puzzles are thrown in for good measure.

[Spoilers

The story is rather lackluster, sometimes I wondered what the heck I was doing,  so I got the plans of the cultist in the hideout, why the hell do I not simply flee, no I need to go up into a stable..and than jump down to get a horse, even if I had free access to the stable to begin with, than the loft freaking has an incredible locking mechanism with three masks, which need to be freed again from other stuff using tools, just to get a freaking lever, who the heck was living in this room before I rummaged trought it?

Than I carry along a firepoker, maybe a bug that it didn't delete, but I could use it, but somehow a broken of arrowstaff is longer than my firepoker, whats the sense in that?
Not to mention that the guards seem useless, there are huge explosions going on, but nope..got to guard those citygates.
Furthermore whats with the ending, it cuts away far to early, I'm in the middle of the woods surrounded by bandits and some kind of witch, I disturbed her ritual and all her other plans, I doubt they would just let me leave.

Edit: Allright I just realised there is another Chapter in the game, you jsut need to access the extra part of the game, however it was initially not clear that there was another Chapter in the extra section, as it just seemed to be about artwork and music.

However they jsut traded one obvious sequelbait for another.

Only recommended for people, who like casual point and clicks or hidden object games,

author: {'steamid': '76561197996678922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1406461405}
review:
At its core, this isn't exactly a hidden-object game... there are some specific scenes that are hidden object; when you are putting together a disguise, or unlocking specific doors... but most of this game is going back and forth through scenes, finding items, and then combining or using those items to solve puzzles.

The biggest problem with this game is that, beyond a few specific puzzles or missing that one item you just can't find/doesn't make sense... to me, this game felt rather simplistic. A lot of the find-object/use-object tasks felt like the game was holding your hand and they didn't require a lot of thought...the hidden-object portions are ridiculously simple, and could be mostly solved with simple random clicking. Lock-picking amounts to finding the right angle, and holding the mouse there for a second, and then doing it again and again and again... not really difficult. Fully completed in roughly 3-4 hours without using any hints and taking my time.

The final level of the game isn't actually obvious... you have to complete the story up to the final section, and then the game just abruptly stops with no solid conclusion. You go back to the main menu, and in the Extra's tab that's now open, there is an option to play the game, and that will start the final level... I'm not sure why they did this... I'm counting that as one of the game's more challenging puzzles. 

The game has interesting ideas, but it doesn't really challenge you at all beyond a few specific logic/game puzzles that can be beaten in a few attempts... that, or I've just played far too many of these games, and these puzzles all start to seem the same.

Fun if you like these kinds of games, but I would wait for a sale... this is more of a rental or tablet/phone game.
